alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Union (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 16 at 2:19AM CDT until April 16 at 8:45AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of North Mississippi and northeast Mississippi, including the following counties, in North Mississippi, Lafayette and Marshall. In northeast Mississippi, Union. * WHEN...Until 530 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 219 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oxford, New Albany, Cambridge, Etta, Pinedale, Harmontown, New Harmony, Keownville, Abbeville, Burt, Keel, Cornersville, Poolville, Old Myrtle, College Hill Station, Bald Hill, Smalco, Martintown, College Hill and Shari. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
